Articles.Content: Well On my 2/3 year old PC(It\'s an acer aspire X1200...) the CD drive that has been there since we got it refuses to open. I have tried EVERYTHING even the paper clip method, it refuses to open. It\'s a 'Labelflash' CD ROM. (According to the front of the drive.) When I press the open button I hear several thumps, it sounds like he mechanism that opens it is hitting the side of the drive. Unfortunatley we don\'t have a warranty as this PC is bought from a renting place.(It was suppost to be a temporary PC.) I was wondering if the drive is bad because we need this for almost every game I play.(I even have backups of MC and my KSP saves,plugins,rocket folders on CDs.) I got it manually opened with a christmas ornament clip.

Considering a replacement drive would cost less than $20, just get a new one. You can even get a better one than what you have if it\'s old.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

PC or laptop?

Both should be removable from the machine, then it\'s a matter of taking a screwdriver to the drive to carefully take the top cover off. then you can usually just remove whatever obstruction is there.

desktop CD drives are cheap, might as well just get a new one.

PC or laptop?

Well On my 2/3 year old PC(It\'s an acer aspire X1200...)

Google says it\'s a desktop.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Desktop. I\'ll look on Amazon or New Egg for a replacement.

Pull the broken one out of your computer (with it turned off of course) and try and open it up and fix it yourself.

It will be a fun adventure, and if you cant fix it, it was broken to begin with and you were going to replace it anyways.
Yeah. The CD tray opening mechanism is typically fairly simple, chances are you might be able to fix it. And if not, you can gut it, attach a handle, and operate the tray manually.
This is your chance to add a DVD read-write to the machine! If you really want to go nuts, get a Blu-ray player and/or writer

If you\'re going to replace it, just try to manually force it/yank it open.

I had a drive having a similar problem. Forcing it open revealed a CD that wasn\'t seated properly; it was jamming it.

This is your chance to add a DVD read-write to the machine! If you really want to go nuts, get a Blu-ray player and/or writer

That\'s what currently is in the machine. The onlytwo computers that don\'t is my research computer(Which I use for gaming xD.) and my sisters used old laptop.
